description.narrative: Project Title: #Study on climate change impacts to agriculture and aquaculture in Mekong Delta provinces for improving and promoting adaptively inclusive business models by Agribusiness targeting to small scale producers# benefits# The Mekong Delta (MRD) is the main agriculture and aquaculture producing region in Vietnam. However, with the terrain lower than sea level and adjacent to both theeast and west sea, the MRD is currently facing many challenges, especially the impact of climate change and sea level rise, threatening agriculture <(>&<)> aquaculture production, people#s livelihood and food security. Development of inclusive and sustainable value chain model has been considered as an appropriate adaptation measure to climate change impacts. It reducesthe constraints of linking commodity-dependent smallholders and small actors to markets by stimulating local business partnership, and hence, helping to improve adaptation and resilience capacity of smallholder groups. However, a number of recent studiesshowed that the linkage in most aquaculture / agriculture value chains in the MRD is very loose and ineffective. In this context, it is necessary to perform a study on climate change impacts to agriculture and aquaculture in MRD provinces for improving and promoting adaptively inclusive business models in agribusiness, targeting to small scale producers# benefits Overall objectives Improving and promoting adaptively inclusivebusiness models by agri-business targeting to small scale producers# benefits that help them to better adaptation to climate change. Main Activities: In influencing agriculture and aquaculture companies to improve and adopt appropriate inclusive investment models, securing small-scale food producers' benefits, three main activities will be carried out including: (1) Perform a study on climatechange impacts to the aquaculture and agriculture for Mekong delta provinces and recommendation for appropriate inclusive investment models by PS against climate change. This activity will be focus on assessment of climate change impacts on rice, fruit (agriculture) and shrimp (aquaculture) production in Vinh Long, An Giang, Soc Trang, Ca Mau and Bac Lieu. (2) Hold a consultation workshop on the study report and recommended adaptively inclusive business models. The workshop will be held in Can Tho. (3) Organized multi-stakeholder dialogue to create awareness of PS on the CC impacts and inclusive business models. The multi-stakeholder dialogue will be organized in Can Tho Expected outcome: At least 30 targeted agriculture and aquaculture companies in the dialogues comprehensively understand and express their interests in reviewing and improving their policies to promote inclusive and sustainable value chains
